com.day.durbo

Class DurboValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.day.durbo.DurboValue

  • public class DurboValue
extends java.lang.Object
    DurboValue implements an internal representation of a value retrieved from the DurboInput. It is either based on bytes or on a stream.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DurboValue(int type, byte[] bytes)
      Creates a new value that is based on a byte array
      DurboValue(int type, java.io.InputStream in, long size)
      Creates a new value that is based on a stream

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns a byte representation of this value.
      double getDouble()
      Returns a double representation of this value.
      long getLength()
      Returns the size of this value
      int getSize()
      Deprecated. 
      since 2.1.2 use getLength() instead.
      java.io.InputStream getStream()
      Returns a stream representation of this value.
      java.lang.String getString()
      Returns a string representation of this value.
      int getType()
      Returns the property type of this value.
      boolean isByteArrayBased()
      Checks if this value internally is based on a byte array.
      Value toJcrValue(ValueFactory factory)
      Returns a new jcr value from this value using the value type.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getLength

        public long getLength()
        Returns the size of this value
        Returns:
        the size of this value

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a byte representation of this value. If this value initially is based on an input stream, it's content are read into a new byte buffer and the stream is closed.
        Returns:
        the byte array of this value
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error during spooling occurs.

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a string representation of this value. the bytes retrieved by getBytes() are converted in a string using utf-8 as encoding.
        Returns:
        the string representation
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error during conversion occurs.

      • getDouble

        public double getDouble()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a double representation of this value. the string retrieved by getString() is converted to a double using Double.parseDouble(String).
        Returns:
        the double value
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an i/O error during conversion occurs.

      • getStream

        public java.io.InputStream getStream()
        Returns a stream representation of this value. if this value originally was based on a stream, this stream is returned otherwise a new ByteArrayInputStream of the internal byte array is returned.
        Returns:
        a stream on this value

      • isByteArrayBased

        public boolean isByteArrayBased()
        Checks if this value internally is based on a byte array.
        Returns:
        true if this value is based on a byte array; false otherwise.

      • toJcrValue

        public Value toJcrValue(ValueFactory factory)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        RepositoryException
        Returns a new jcr value from this value using the value type. If this value is of type PropertyType#BINARY the new value is created using getStream(), otherwise the new value is created using getString().
        Parameters:
        factory - the value factory that is used to create the value
        Returns:
        the new jcr value
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        RepositoryException - if a repository error occurs.
